citation.article-title: Sulfurospirillum barnesii sp. nov. and Sulfurospirillum arsenophilum sp. nov., new members of the Sulfurospirillum clade of the epsilon Proteobacteria.

p.s: Description of Sulfurospirillum arsenophilum sp. nov.

Sulfurospirillum arsenophilum (ar.sen.o'phi.lum. Gr. n. arsenikon yellow orpiment, arsenic; Gr. adj. -philos loving; N.L. adj. arsenophilum arsenic-loving, named because of its ability to grow dissimilatorily on arsenate)
Vibrioid to spirillum-shaped cells, 0.3 μm wide and 1-2 μm in length.
Growth optima are 20°C, pH 7.5 and 0.1% NaCl.
Hydrogen and formate can serve as electron donors when acetate is used as the carbon source.
Lactate, pyruvate and fumarate can be used as electron donors.
Arsenate, nitrate and fumarate can serve as terminal electron acceptors.
The G+C content of the DNA is 40.9 mol%.
Strain MIT-13T (=ATCC 700056T) is the type strain.
